title: Experts doubt Mexico's pledge to protect endangered porpoise
description: Mexico has announced a new program to protect the endangered vaquita marina porpoise, saying that has headed off trade sanctions by the international wildlife body CITES

title: Mexico's immigration chief called to court over deadly fire
description: Mexican prosecutors say the head of the country’s immigration agency is scheduled to make an initial appearance in court as part of their investigation of a fire at a detention center last month that killed 40 migrants

title: Puerto Rico governor's 2 cousins guilty in embezzlement case
description: Two cousins of Puerto Rico’s Gov. Pedro Pierluisi have pleaded guilty for embezzling millions of dollars in federal funds earmarked for the management of public housing on the island

title: Ex-Haiti senator's driver detained in president's slaying
description: Authorities in Haiti say the driver of a former Haitian senator has been detained for questioning in the assassination of former Haitian President Jovenel Moise

title: 25 Europe-bound migrants dead in boat sinking off Tunisia
description: Tunisian authorities say at least 25 African migrants died and 15 are missing after a boat carrying them toward Europe sank in the Mediterranean Sea

title: Ex-Colombia rebel urges armed groups to support government
description: A former Colombian rebel leader who now heads a political party has addressed the U.N. Security Council for the first time

title: Israeli police absolved in killing of Palestinian at Al-Aqsa
description: Israeli authorities say an internal investigation into the killing of a 26-year-old Palestinian citizen of Israel earlier this month at Jerusalem’s most sensitive holy site found no wrongdoing by the police

title: Peru politician convicted in reporter's murder 35 years ago
description: A Peruvian judge has convicted and retired army general and conservative politician Daniel Urresti to 12 years in prison Thursday for his role 35 years ago in the murder of a journalist who covered abuses during Peru’s civil war

title: UN, others cite new displacement from Ethiopia's Tigray
description: Aid workers in Ethiopia say Amhara’s regional forces have displaced tens of thousands of ethnic Tigrayans from disputed territory in the north of the country in recent weeks, despite a peace deal last year

title: Russia names Ukrainian suspect in blast that killed prowar blogger
description: Russia's Federal Security Service said that the suspect was working for the Ukrainian special services and had supplied the bomb used in the St. Petersburg attack.

title: Promising new malaria vaccine for kids approved in Ghana
description: Ghana became the first country to approve a new malaria vaccine for young children that may offer better protection against the disease that kills hundreds of thousands every year

title: Heavy rains in Iran trigger flash floods, killing at least 2
description: Iranian state TV says heavy rains have triggered flash flooding in northern and western Iran, killing at least two people

title: Mary Quant, British designer who dressed the swinging ’60s, dies at 93
description: She helped popularize the miniskirt and designed youthful, colorful clothes that embodied a freewheeling era.

title: Russia says China agreed to secretly provide weapons, leaked documents show
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | U.S. eavesdropping reveals that Russia’s Foreign Intelligence Service believed they had a deal with Beijing for provision of “lethal aid.”

title: India escalates fight against BBC with new financial case
description: India’s financial agency registered a case against the broadcaster, the latest crackdown since the BBC released a controversial documentary about the prime minister.

title: UN rights chief seeks help for surge in central Med migrants
description: The U.N. human rights chief is calling for an expansion in regular migration channels and search-and-rescue operations after a “steep increase” in the number of migrants and asylum-seekers making risky attempts to cross the central Mediterranean to Europe

title: Biden says nothing of 'great consequence' in Pentagon leaks
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday said while he was concerned that sensitive government documents had been leaked, “there’s nothing contemporaneous that I’m aware of that is of great consequence.”

title: Indonesia police kill 2 suspected Jemaah Islamiyah militants
description: Indonesia’s counterterrorism police squad has killed two men suspected of ties to Jemaah Islamiyah, an al-Qaida-linked group blamed for a string of past bombings

title: Lebanese judge lifts travel ban from central bank governor
description: A Lebanese judge has rescinded a travel ban she had placed on the country’s embattled central bank governor, clearing the way for him to travel to Paris for a scheduled hearing with French prosecutors next month

title: Official: Russia may discuss swap involving WSJ reporter
description: A top Russian diplomat says Moscow may be willing to discuss a potential prisoner swap involving jailed Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich after a court delivers its verdict

title: South Korea faces ‘Sophie’s choice’ over sending weapons to Ukraine
description: South Korea produces a huge amount of ammunition, a result of the Korean War, but is resisting growing pressure to export much-needed supplies to Ukraine.

title: Taliban share rare audio message from supreme leader
description: The Taliban’s supreme leader says Afghanistan will be ruined without justice, in a rare audio message shared on social media

title: Ukraine stands firm on Crimea, wants Russia out of all areas
description: Ukraine’s foreign minister says his country won’t budge from its demand that Russia withdraw its forces from Crimea, as well as from other parts of Ukraine that Moscow illegally annexed more recently

title: Europe needs energy. Moroccan solar may be a clean solution.
description: Morocco and North Africa's solar energy could help Europe free itself from Russian fossil fuels.

title: Prosecutors: German climate demo didn't cause cyclist death
description: German prosecutors say they have determined that climate protesters weren’t responsible for the death in October of a cyclist after their road blockade caused a delay in the arrival of a rescue vehicle at an accident scene

title: Suspect extradited from Pakistan over 2005 UK police slaying
description: A 74-year-old man extradited from Pakistan has appeared in a London court to face a murder charge in the death of a police officer who was fatally shot while responding to a bank robbery almost two decades ago

title: U.S. won’t press charges related to Shanquella Robinson’s death in Mexico
description: After U.S. authorities said there was insufficient evidence for prosecution, an attorney for the 25-year-old's family said they were disappointed but not deterred.

title: Northern China blanketed with floating sand and dust
description: Many areas in northern China are blanketed with floating sand and dust, and a sandstorm is expected to sweep through parts of Inner Mongolia

title: Holy Land Christians say attacks rising in far-right Israel
description: The head of the Roman Catholic Church in the Holy Land has warned in an interview that the rise of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s far-right government has made life worse for Christians in the birthplace of Christianity

title: Anne Perry, crime novelist with her own murder record, dies at 84
description: As a teen, the best-selling author helped kill the mother of her friend Pauline Parker. Her identity was later exposed in the movie “Heavenly Creatures.”

title: Sudan's military warns of conflict after rival force deploys
description: Sudan’s military has warned about potential clashes with the country’s powerful paramilitary force which it said deployed troops in the capital and other cities

title: Ukraine live briefing: Two Americans killed in Ukraine; war likely to spill into 2024, leaked documents say
description: A stalemate in Ukraine — with neither Kyiv nor Moscow inclined to negotiate — is the most likely scenario, according to the leaked intelligence documents.

title: The West hoped Lula would be a partner. He’s got his own plans.
description: Brazil’s new president risks alienating the U.S. and Europe as he hosts Iranian warships, equivocates over Russia's invasion of Ukraine and negotiates with China.

title: Syria, Saudi Arabia move toward restoring embassies, flights
description: Syria and Saudi Arabia say they have started procedures to reopen embassies and resume flights between the two countries for the first time in more than a decade

title: 4 firefighters die in garment factory blaze in Pakistan
description: Officials say four firefighters have died and nearly a dozen others were injured after a massive fire broke out in a garment factory in the southern Pakistan port city of Karachi

title: Category 4 Cyclone Ilsa lashes northwest Australian coast
description: A severe tropical cyclone is lashing the northwest Australian coast with strengthening winds and increasing rain
